div.div: οὖν : inferential or resumptive particle, now, then, in Homer regularly found in connection with some other particle, γὰρ οὖν, ἐπεὶ οὖν, ὡς οὖν, μὲν οὖν, and as in the 1st or 2d of a pair of correlative clauses, οὔτ᾽ οὖν.. οὔτε, Od. 1.414; εἴ γ̓ οὖν ἕτερός γε φύγῃσιν, if ‘for that matter,’ etc., Il. 5.258. The various shades of meaning assumed by οὖν must be learned from the context of the passages in which it occurs.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
